Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Framework Generation constants for Search-by-TFM" (#9270) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This is part of the work in https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Jobs/pull/1096.

We will need to use these constants to represent Framework Generations in the search index, and in the URL query parameters, so they will be used by both NuGet.Jobs and NuGetGallery.

These Framework Generation strings are based on the shortname framework identifiers. There isn't currently a shortname identifier for .NET Framework (< 5.0), so we created our own constants, which includes "netframework" for .NET Framework.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Framework Generation constants for Search-by-TFM" (#9270) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This is part of the work in https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Jobs/pull/1096.

We will need to use these constants to represent Framework Generations in the search index, and in the URL query parameters, so they will be used by both NuGet.Jobs and NuGetGallery.

These Framework Generation strings are based on the shortname framework identifiers. There isn't currently a shortname identifier for .NET Framework (< 5.0), so we created our own constants, which includes "netframework" for .NET Framework.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: [Bug Bash][Localization] The translation of string “NuGet storage cleared at (current time)” in Options window is incorrect" (#12108) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

Dev\6.4.0.97

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

#### Details about Problem
VS Version: Main\32922.386 (installed “Chinese (Simplified)” language pack)
NuGet Version: Dev\6.4.0.97
OS Version: Windows-11-Enterprise-21H2 ENU

#### Detailed repro steps
1. Open VS, click menu Tools->Options->Environment->International Settings and select “中文(简体)” in the “Language” dropdown list and restart VS.
2. Create a “C# Console App (.NET 7.0)” project in VS.
3. Right-Click the project in the Solution Explorer window and select ‘Manage NuGet Packages…’.
4. Click the “Browse” tab and install some packages into this project.
5. Click the settings button on the top-right of PM UI to open the Options window.
6. Go to NuGet Package Manager->General tab and click the “Clear All NuGet Storage” button.

#### Expected
The translation should be “在9/23/2022 2:09:53 AM已清除NuGet存储”.

#### Actual 
The translation is incorrect as “已清除 9/23/2022 2:09:53 AM 处的 NuGet 存储” since the “9/23/2022 2:09:53 AM” is a time not a place.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/191941090-07ec2661-c05d-40fb-ac5e-f7234287c440.png)
#### Notes:
It doesn’t repro on D16.11\32802.440.


### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Opened issue "Install-Package : Dependency loop detected for package 'Microsoft.Data.SqlClient'." (#12133) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: I continue to get the error "Install-Package : Dependency loop detected for package 'Microsoft.Data.SqlClient'." when trying to install the package Microsoft.Data.SqlClient in PowerShell. I've seen a couple issues that reference this but they're closed and yet I'm still not able to install the package successfully.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: dotnet list vulnerable include transitive fails to report System.Text.Encodings.Web v4.7.1 as vulnerable" (#12132) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

6.0.400

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

1. Clone repo to local machine: https://github.com/JDetmar/NLog.Extensions.AzureStorage
2. Open Command Prompt and run this command:
```
dotnet list ./src package --vulnerable --include-transitive
```
3. Fails to report solution depends on [System.Text.Encodings.Web v4.7.1](https://www.nuget.org/packages/System.Text.Encodings.Web/4.7.1) marked as vulnerable.

P.S. Also tried changing `NLog.Extensions.AzureBlobStorage.Tests` to have targetframework=net48, but still no report of it being vulnerable..

### Verbose Logs

```shell
Project `NLog.Extensions.AzureBlobStorage` has the following vulnerable packages
   [netstandard2.0]:
   Transitive Package                    Resolved   Severity   Advisory URL
   > System.Text.RegularExpressions      4.3.0      Moderate   https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-cmhx-cq75-c4mj

The given project `NLog.Extensions.AzureBlobStorage.Tests` has no vulnerable packages given the current sources.
Project `NLog.Extensions.AzureQueueStorage.Tests` has the following vulnerable packages
   [netcoreapp3.1]:
   Transitive Package                    Resolved   Severity   Advisory URL
   > Newtonsoft.Json                     9.0.1      High       https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5crp-9r3c-p9vr
   > System.Text.RegularExpressions      4.3.0      Moderate   https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-cmhx-cq75-c4mj
```

Would expect with `--include-transitive` that it would report that [System.Text.Json v4.7.2](https://www.nuget.org/packages/System.Text.Json/4.7.2#dependencies-body-tab) depends on vulnerable version [System.Text.Encodings.Web v4.7.1](https://www.nuget.org/packages/System.Text.Encodings.Web/4.7.1):

> NLog.Extensions.AzureBlobStorage@3.1.1 › Azure.Storage.Blobs@12.13.0 › System.Text.Json@4.7.2 › System.Text.Encodings.Web@4.7.1
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Details for Installed MAUI packages are missing NuGet Project PM UI" (#12130) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/Details-for-Installed-MAUI-packages-are-/10119414)._

---
[severity:It's more difficult to complete my work]
Repro Steps:

1. Open Visual Studio 2022 17.3
2. Create a New MAUI App
3. Let Visual Studio finish all background tasks
4. Right click on Project, 'Manage NuGet Packages...'

Expected: PM UI shows package details on Installed Tab, on Details pane when the package is clicked

Actual: No details info shown.

**NOTE**: This works well in Solution PM UI.

---
### Original Comments

(private comment, text removed)
#### Feedback Bot on 8/18/2022, 01:21 PM: 

(private comment, text removed)

---

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: Visual Studio Credential Provider error handler inconsistency" (#12129) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI, Visual Studio Package Manager Console

### Product Version

all

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

_No response_

### Repro Steps & Context

[The XML docs for `IVsCredentialProvider`](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/a5baa60cfd7560904a264cae1c21eff3498be177/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.VisualStudio/Extensibility/IVsCredentialProvider.cs#L37) says:

> Credentials acquired by this provider for the given package source uri.
> If the provider does not handle requests for the input parameter set, then null should be returned.
> If the provider does handle the request, but cannot supply credentials, an exception should be thrown.

However, [`HttpSourceAuthenticationHandler` catches exceptions and then blocks the credential provider for the rest of the process lifetime](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Protocol/HttpSource/HttpSourceAuthenticationHandler.cs#L273-L281).

Therefore, there's no way for a VS credential provider to have a transient issue that NuGet can recover from without Visual Studio being closed and restarted.

May be related to https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/12062.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Transition from Symantec timestamping service to DigiCert timestamping service" (#64) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Between October 4th, 2022 and October 24, 2022 we will transition from the deprecated Symantec timestamping service currently in use to the DigiCert timestamping service for both Microsoft author signing and NuGet.org repository signing NuGet packages for new package submissions only.

*  October 4th – October 24th:  Update NuGet.org repository signing to use http://timestamp.digicert.com/. Although all environments (DEV, INT, and PROD) will be updated during this window, http://nuget.org (PROD) specifically will be updated only near the beginning and end of this window.
*  October 18th – 20th:  Update Microsoft author signing to use http://timestamp.digicert.com/.
 
We expect a smooth and quiet transition; however, if you have questions or concerns, either contact support@nuget.org or post [here](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9259).
 
Please see [dotnet/core#7688](https://github.com/dotnet/core/issues/7688) and [Proposal to re-enable signed NuGet package verification](https://github.com/dotnet/designs/blob/main/accepted/2021/signed-package-verification/re-enable-signed-package-verification.md) for context.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Connection] Deprecating legacy cipher suites at www.nuget.org" (#63) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
In order to provide a more secure and compliant environment for our customers, we are planning to deprecate legacy cipher suites and only support the following cipher suites at [www.nuget.org](http://www.nuget.org/):

TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384

Between 08/31/2022 07:00 PM UTC and 09/02/2022 07:00 PM UTC, we will take a test for this deprecation to understand the broken change for our customers. Based on our telemetry, we expect the impact to be minimal, but if you meet any connection issues at [www.nuget.org](http://www.nuget.org/) or have any questions, do reach out to us at [support@nuget.org](mailto:support@nuget.org) or by commenting on the discussion issue: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9216. We will be closely monitoring our communication channels to assess any unexpected impact.
